title: Workshop 3: adoption studies
text:
Materials:




Access the workshop files:Please download the required dataset from the shared folder. Workshop dataset
Conduct descriptive analysis: Summarize key variables (e.g., age, education, farm size, and more) or generate frequency tables and mean comparisons
Determine Factors Affecting Adoption: Run the following regression models:

OLS (Linear Probability Model) ‚Äì for a basic understanding, though not ideal for binary outcomes
Probit Model ‚Äì uses cumulative normal distribution to estimate adoption probability
Logit Model ‚Äì uses logistic distribution for binary outcomes

Identify Significant Variables: Examine p-values and coefficients from each model. Identify which variables significantly influence adoption decisions.
Interpret the coefficients of the significant variables affecting adoption









Output submission




Upload your .do file and the exported excel files containing the results for linear probability model (LPM) or OLS, probit, and logit.

Upload your output here

title: Workshop 1: Developing Impact Pathway
text:
Materials:




Impact Pathway Template: Google Slide Template Here
Discussion prompts: Consider the following questions as you work:

Are the connections between each box logical and realistic?
What assumptions are you making about the ‚ÄúAdoption Pathway‚Äù?
How will you measure the changes in ‚ÄúProject Outcomes‚Äù and ‚ÄúProject Impacts‚Äù




View template in new window Submit your output here



Instructions:

Access the Template: You will be provided with a link to a Google Slides presentation. This presentation contains a pre-formatted template for the impact pathway.
Make a Copy: Once you open the link, go to File > Make a copy > Entire presentation. Rename the file with your team or project name (e.g., ‚ÄúTeam Alpha - Impact Pathway‚Äù or ‚ÄúProject X - Impact Pathway‚Äù). This will ensure you can edit your own version without affecting the original template.
Collaborate with Your Group: Work with your assigned group to fill in each section of the impact pathway diagram. Use the template as your guide. The different sections are as follows:

R.D.E. Project Outputs: What specific deliverables or results are produced directly by your project? Consider the categories of Technology, Capacity Development, and Policy.
Adoption Pathway: How do the project outputs translate into actions or changes by your target audience? Think about the steps that lead from the outputs to the outcomes, such as Commercialization, Communication, Capacity Building, and Regulation.
Project Outcomes: What are the short-to-medium-term changes that occur as a result of the project outputs being adopted? Focus on changes in Practice, Product, and Policy.
Project Impacts: What are the long-term, broader effects of the project outcomes? Categorize these impacts as Economic, Social, and Environmental.

Presentation of Workshop Outputs: A representative from each team will have 5-10 minutes to explain their group‚Äôs pathway. The focus should be on clearly articulating the logical flow from outputs to impacts and justifying the connections between each stage.

title: Lecture 6: Cost-benefit analysis
text:
Topic outline

Importance of Cost ‚Äì Benefit Analysis in the context of Impact Assessment
Examples of Costs and Benefits
Net Present Value (NPV): present value of benefits versus investment costs
Internal Rate of Return (IRR): the rate of return at which the investment value is equal to the value of the benefit flow
Benefit-Cost Ratio: ratio of the present value of the benefits to the present value of the total investment costs (including implementation costs)
Sensitivity Analysis: the process of generating alternate cases to check the effect of changes in essential variables
Scenario Analysis: the formulation of various scenarios (best, base, worst) to review CBA metrics

View presentation in new window

title: Workshop 2: use and application of Stata and R
text:
Stata






Materials




Download the Stata software. You can download the Stata installation files from the shared folder:

Stata software download folder

Access the Stata tutorial: A tutorial PDF is provided to help you get started with Stata‚Äôs interface, basic commands, and data operations.



View PDF in new window




R programming






Materials




Download R and RStudio: To get started, install both R and RStudio:

Download R
Download RStudio Desktop
Make sure to select the version that matches your operating system (Windows, macOS, or Linux).

To help you install R and RStudio smoothly, watch one of the following tutorial videos below.

How to Install R and RStudio on Windows 11
Download and Install R and R Studio in Simple Steps
How to Install R and RStudio on Windows 10/11 [2024]
Installing R and R Studio | R for Data Analytics Series
How to download and install R and RStudio
Install R and R Studio | Learn R

Download the R project folder. We will be using this one for the entire R sessions.

R project folder
